intro: Parsonsia schoddei, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking red and orange tubular flowers that resemble bells. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers bloom in spring and are pollinated primarily by birds, particularly honeyeaters.
